TopicTitle: If anyone was wondering, you can tone down fairing snap in their config files.

Articles.Content:
![1972473_10101350241876429_1594454895_n.jpg](https://ifhappinesscanlastforever.files.wordpress.com/2014/04/1972473_10101350241876429_1594454895_n.jpg)

Honestly though, this has been an annoying little thing for me as I like styling fairing as much as I *possibly* can and the "0.1" default snap was a bit too rigid for me. Search "snapThreshold" in the config files and you can tweak that to your liking.

If only there was a feature that would do this automatically. Possibly toggle 2 configurable values, or more with something like editor extensions.

Angle snap, I'm looking at you.
You can also edit the max and min height!

> 
> You can also edit the max and min height!

That too! Thanks for mentioning it ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
So will someone who doesn't mod the files see the effect?
is there also a config for determining how many pieces the fairing separates into. Really tired of the popcorn-style jettisons and would like a standard 2-piece fairing.
What is the file we need to edit? And better yet, can this be done with module manager instead?

> 
> is there also a config for determining how many pieces the fairing separates into. Really tired of the popcorn-style jettisons and would like a standard 2-piece fairing.

While there isn't a separate cfg for that, I suspect if you set the max height to an extremely large value you could get it to separate into less pieces. 

But you are still going to have to deal with a few pieces. Or you could just download Procedural Fairings unless you are playing completely vanilla.
Actually, if you click the link in my sig, there's an addon that allows "stock" clamshell fairings.
